I would say it looks to fit into the Kyosukashi school.  I was looking 
at =
it yesterday and it seems to be a nice piece.  The small kogaibitsu 
would =
point toward an earlier piece. However, I suppose it could be an 
1800's Ba=
kamatsu period piece.   I don't have it in hand nor the 
experience with me=
tal types to make a qualified decision.  In any case 
the price seems reaso=
nable.
